intro: Castanopsis thaiensis, commonly known as Thai chestnut. It is a species of evergreen tree belonging to the Fagaceae family, native to Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and produces small, spiny fruits that contain edible seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soils. The botanical features of Castanopsis thaiensis make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
